lines.text: Come on inside honey.
But I wanna go with them! I want to fly too!
Well, you'll have to ask Santa about that.
Is he coming back?
Yes - next year.
Good, then I'll wait right here!
[she sits down in the snow]
Er, you know, a year, is a very, very long time, young lady. Maybe - you'd better wait inside the barn. At least that's my opinion.
[talking about the bullies Bucky and Buster]
I hope Santa has nothing but dolls when he gets to their house.
[Billy nods, then suddenly looks shocked]
Well he's gotta leave them *something*.

[after Billy and Annabelle meets for the first time outside and begin to play, Agnes joins Grandpa's side]
You gave him a cow for Christmas?
No, it was Santa Claus.
You're teaching the boy to believe in that fantasy?
Ain't nothin' wrong with a little believin', after what he's been through.
Exactly! This dreadful barn is a constant reminder of that horrible fire. This barn just isn't safe, let alone for a boy who can't talk!

[the Holder Brothers are bullying Billy, again]
How come you only hang around with girls?
And cows?
[He pushes Billy, making him fall on the snow]
Huh, Billy? How come?

[angry]
Why don't you leave him alone?
he can't talk.
You're just jealous 'cause YOU don't have any friends!

[pushing her as well]
Stay out of this, Emily!
[as she glares at them, they began to laugh. Annabelle, fed up with the teasing, charges at them and hits them square in their stomachs, making them fall down with a loud SPLAT]

[as the Narrator, talking about Annabelle,Billy and Emily]
Talkin' just wasn't required for the kind of friendship they had.
